name: Mexican Charred Tomatillo Salsa
author: Sony
summary: This delicious Mexican salsa (Salsa martajada de tomate verde) is made with fresh tomatillos, chiles de arbol, and garlic. Everything is chargrilled till blackened, imparting a smoky flavor that makes this salsa so special. Serve with tortilla chips, or as an accompaniment to your favorite Mexican meal.
directions: Line a heavy cast iron grill pan or griddle with aluminum foil and place over high heat
Arrange tomatillos, chiles de arbol, and garlic in a single layer on top
Grill until chiles are blackened, turning as necessary, 3 to 5 minutes
Continue grilling tomatillos and garlic until they are evenly blackened, 8 to 10 minutes more
Peel garlic and place in a mortar and pestle
Season with salt and pound into a thick paste
Add as many tomatillos as you can fit in your mortar; pound until chunky
Repeat with remaining tomatillos, mixing them into the bowl of salsa in batches
